greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = largest of those positive integers which are coprime to both n and n+1 and which are <= n.
link: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: The positive integers which are coprime to 8 and which are <= 8 are 1,3,5,7. The positive integers which are coprime to 9 and which are <= 9 are 1, 2,4,5,7,8. So a(8) = 7, which is the largest of those integers in both these sequences (1,5,7).
mathematica: f[n_] := Last @ Select[Range[n], GCD[n, # ] == GCD[n + 1, # ] == 1 &];Table[f[n], {n, 75}] (* _Ray Chandler_, Nov 10 2006 *)
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Nov 06 2006
